DOC.brief_summary: This study will examine how anaesthetic technique affects ECT outcomes. Specifically, the investigators will examine how: 1) the time interval between anaesthetic and ECT stimulus, and 2) the ventilation rate before ECT stimulus, impacts on the quality of the EEG (this is a recording of brain activity during ECT and is used to judge the quality of a seizure and to guide individual patient dosing).
DOC.brief_title: Understanding How Anaesthesia Affects ECT Outcomes
DOC.detailed_description: This study aims to examine how the time interval between administration of anaesthetic agent and ECT stimulus delivery impacts upon measures of EEG quality (seizure quality).
DOC.criteria: Patients treated with a course of ECT Use of nonstandard anaesthetic agents in ECT (e.g. ketamine)
